SubstackSignup.title: Be in the know
SubstackSignup.description: Join my newsletter to get new blog posts delivered straight to your inbox. I write about startups, crypto, building in public and lessons learned from my journey as a founder.

Feed.sectionSubtitle: Check out my latest content from YouTube and X

FilmsPage.title: Films & TV
FilmsPage.subtitle: My film & TV review diary
FilmsPage.marginCallDescription: A riveting thriller set over 24 hours at a Wall Street investment bank on the brink of the 2008 financial crisis.
FilmsPage.theBigShortDescription: A darkly comedic retelling of the true story of the investors who predicted and profited from the 2008 housing market collapse.
FilmsPage.theWolfOfWallStreetDescription: The outrageous true story of Jordan Belfort, a stockbroker who defrauded investors out of millions while living a life of excess.
FilmsPage.billionsDescription: A high-stakes drama about a ruthless hedge fund manager locked in a power struggle with a determined US Attorney.
FilmsPage.goldDescription: Based on true events, a prospector teams up with a geologist to find gold in the Indonesian jungle, leading to a massive mining scandal.
FilmsPage.warDogsDescription: Two young men exploit a government initiative to become international arms dealers, based on a shocking true story.
FilmsPage.uncutGemsDescription: A charismatic jeweller in New York's Diamond District makes increasingly desperate high-stakes bets to stay ahead of his mounting debts.
FilmsPage.catchMeIfYouCanDescription: The true story of Frank Abagnale Jr., a brilliant con artist who successfully impersonated a pilot, doctor, and lawyer — all before his 19th birthday.
FilmsPage.wecrashedDescription: The gripping rise and fall of WeWork and its charismatic but delusional co-founder Adam Neumann.
FilmsPage.djangoUnchainedDescription: A freed slave teams up with a German bounty hunter to rescue his wife from a brutal Mississippi plantation owner.
FilmsPage.pulpFictionDescription: Interwoven tales of crime and redemption in Los Angeles, told in Tarantino's signature non-linear style.
FilmsPage.inglouriousBasterdsDescription: A squad of Jewish-American soldiers plots to assassinate Nazi leaders in occupied France during World War II.
FilmsPage.kidulthoodDescription: A raw and unflinching look at 48 hours in the lives of a group of teenagers in West London.
FilmsPage.adulthoodDescription: Six years after the events of Kidulthood, Sam is released from prison and must face the consequences of his past.
FilmsPage.brotherhoodDescription: The final chapter in the trilogy follows Sam as he tries to leave his past behind while old enemies resurface.
FilmsPage.riseOfTheFootsoldierDescription: The brutal true story of a football hooligan turned gangster in Essex's criminal underworld during the 1980s and 90s.
FilmsPage.topBoySummerhouseDescription: The original Channel 4 series following drug dealers navigating the dangerous estate life in Hackney, East London.
FilmsPage.topBoyDescription: The Netflix revival continues the story of Dushane and Sully as they fight to reclaim their position in London's drug trade.
FilmsPage.peakyBlindersDescription: A gangster family epic set in 1920s Birmingham, following the Shelby crime dynasty's rise to power.
FilmsPage.snatchDescription: An intricate web of London gangsters, dodgy boxing promoters, and a stolen diamond collide in this razor-sharp crime comedy.
FilmsPage.lockStockAndTwoSmokingBarrelsDescription: Four East End lads get drawn into a web of crime after a rigged card game leaves them owing half a million pounds.
FilmsPage.breakingBadDescription: A high school chemistry teacher turns to manufacturing methamphetamine after being diagnosed with terminal cancer.
FilmsPage.betterCallSaulDescription: The prequel to Breaking Bad follows small-time lawyer Jimmy McGill's transformation into the morally flexible Saul Goodman.
FilmsPage.elCaminoABreakingBadMovieDescription: Following the events of Breaking Bad, Jesse Pinkman escapes captivity and must come to terms with his past to forge a new future.
FilmsPage.interstellarDescription: A team of explorers travel through a wormhole in space to find a new habitable planet as Earth faces environmental collapse.
FilmsPage.parasiteDescription: A poor family schemes to infiltrate a wealthy household, with devastating and darkly comic consequences.
FilmsPage.blackMirrorDescription: A dystopian anthology series exploring the dark side of technology and its impact on modern society.
FilmsPage.oblivionDescription: In a post-apocalyptic Earth, a drone repairman discovers a crashed spacecraft with contents that question everything he believes.
FilmsPage.exMachinaDescription: A young programmer is selected to participate in an experiment evaluating the human qualities of a highly advanced AI.
FilmsPage.iAmMotherDescription: A teenage girl raised by a robot in an underground bunker begins to question her world when a stranger arrives.
FilmsPage.snowpiercerDescription: In a frozen post-apocalyptic world, the last survivors live aboard a perpetually moving train divided by class.
FilmsPage.getOutDescription: A young Black man visits his white girlfriend's family estate, where increasingly sinister events reveal a terrifying conspiracy.
FilmsPage.prisonersDescription: When two young girls go missing, a desperate father takes matters into his own hands while a detective pursues every lead.
FilmsPage.birdBoxDescription: A woman and her children must navigate a dangerous river blindfolded to escape mysterious entities that drive people to suicide.
FilmsPage.thePlatformDescription: In a vertical prison where food descends floor by floor, inmates must fight starvation and each other in a brutal social experiment.
FilmsPage.thePlatform2Description: A new group of inmates faces the vertical prison, this time with a twisted set of rules that make survival even more complex.
FilmsPage.glassOnionAKnivesOutMysteryDescription: Detective Benoit Blanc travels to a tech billionaire's private Greek island to peel back the layers of a new mystery among his eccentric friends.
FilmsPage.dontLookUpDescription: Two astronomers discover a comet heading for Earth but struggle to convince a distracted, media-obsessed world to take it seriously.
FilmsPage.thePerksOfBeingAWallflowerDescription: An introverted freshman navigates the complexities of adolescence with the help of two charismatic seniors.
FilmsPage.titanicDescription: A seventeen-year-old aristocrat falls in love with a free-spirited artist aboard the ill-fated R.M.S. Titanic.
FilmsPage.thePursuitOfHappynessDescription: The inspiring true story of Chris Gardner, a struggling salesman who becomes homeless while raising his young son and chasing a career in stockbroking.
FilmsPage.theBoyInTheStripedPyjamasDescription: The innocent friendship between the son of a Nazi commandant and a Jewish boy imprisoned in a concentration camp.
FilmsPage.jokerDescription: A failed comedian's descent into madness transforms him into Gotham City's most notorious criminal — the Joker.
FilmsPage.theIrishmanDescription: An ageing hitman reflects on his life of crime, his involvement with the Bufalino crime family, and the disappearance of Jimmy Hoffa.
FilmsPage.forrestGumpDescription: A kind-hearted man with a low IQ unwittingly influences several defining historical events in 20th century America.
FilmsPage.theQueensGambitDescription: An orphaned chess prodigy battles addiction while rising through the ranks of the male-dominated chess world during the Cold War.
FilmsPage.babyReindeerDescription: A struggling comedian's life spirals when a chance encounter with a woman at his bar leads to an increasingly disturbing obsession.
FilmsPage.dexterDescription: A forensic blood spatter analyst for the Miami police secretly leads a double life as a serial killer who targets other murderers.
FilmsPage.tigerKingDescription: The bizarre true story of Joe Exotic, a zoo owner caught in a web of murder-for-hire, big cat breeding, and bitter rivalries.
FilmsPage.jimmySavileABritishHorrorStoryDescriptio: A chilling documentary examining how Jimmy Savile hid decades of predatory behaviour behind his celebrity status and charity work.
FilmsPage.hitlerTheRiseOfEvilDescription: A two-part dramatisation of Adolf Hitler's early life and his terrifying ascent from failed artist to dictator of Germany.
FilmsPage.squidGameDescription: Hundreds of cash-strapped contestants accept an invitation to compete in children's games for a massive prize — with deadly consequences.
FilmsPage.theExpendablesDescription: An elite team of mercenaries is tasked with overthrowing a ruthless Latin American dictator.
FilmsPage.theExpendables2Description: The mercenaries reunite for a seemingly simple job that goes wrong, leading them on a path of revenge.
FilmsPage.theExpendables3Description: Barney Ross recruits a new generation of younger mercenaries to take down an old co-founder turned arms dealer.
FilmsPage.avengersEndgameDescription: The Avengers assemble for one final stand to undo Thanos' catastrophic snap and restore the universe.
FilmsPage.angelHasFallenDescription: Secret Service agent Mike Banning is framed for an assassination attempt on the President and must clear his name.
FilmsPage.londonHasFallenDescription: World leaders are targeted at the British Prime Minister's funeral, and Mike Banning must protect the US President through a besieged London.
FilmsPage.jurassicWorldDescription: A fully operational dinosaur theme park descends into chaos when a genetically modified hybrid dinosaur escapes containment.
FilmsPage.jurassicWorldFallenKingdomDescription: A rescue mission to save dinosaurs from an erupting volcanic island turns into a conspiracy involving weaponised creatures.
FilmsPage.homefrontDescription: A former DEA agent moves to a small town for a quieter life but finds himself in conflict with the local meth operation.
FilmsPage.spenserConfidentialDescription: An ex-cop returns from prison to find that two of his former colleagues have been murdered, pulling him back into Boston's criminal underworld.
FilmsPage.centralIntelligenceDescription: A mild-mannered accountant is drawn into a high-stakes CIA mission by his former high school classmate — now a rogue agent.
FilmsPage.vikingsDescription: The legendary Norse hero Ragnar Lothbrok rises from farmer to fearsome warrior and king, leading raids on England and beyond.
FilmsPage.aboutABoyDescription: A wealthy, idle Londoner pretends to have a son to meet single mothers, only to form a genuine bond with an awkward young boy.
FilmsPage.peepShowDescription: The excruciatingly awkward lives of two dysfunctional flatmates in London, told through their brutally honest internal monologues.
FilmsPage.theInbetweenersDescription: Four socially awkward suburban teenagers navigate the horrors of sixth form, girls, and their own stupidity.
FilmsPage.afterLifeDescription: A man whose wife has died considers ending his life but instead decides to punish the world by saying and doing whatever he wants.
FilmsPage.derekDescription: A kind-hearted man works at a care home for the elderly, brightening the lives of residents and staff alike.
FilmsPage.theOfficeDescription: A documentary crew captures the mundane and excruciatingly awkward daily lives of office workers at a paper company in Slough.
FilmsPage.badEducationDescription: A posh, incompetent teacher at a failing school in Watford causes chaos for his unruly class and fellow staff.
FilmsPage.orangeIsTheNewBlackDescription: A privileged New Yorker's life is turned upside down when she's sentenced to a women's federal prison for a decade-old crime.
FilmsPage.brooklynNinenineDescription: A talented but immature detective and his diverse colleagues solve crimes in Brooklyn's 99th precinct under their new, uptight captain.
FilmsPage.sexEducationDescription: A socially awkward teenager with a sex therapist mother sets up an underground sex therapy clinic at his school.
FilmsPage.thisCountryDescription: A mockumentary following two cousins navigating the boredom and eccentricity of rural village life in the Cotswolds.
FilmsPage.motherlandDescription: A sharp comedy about the competitive, cliquey world of middle-class parenting at the school gates.
FilmsPage.fridayNightDinnerDescription: Two brothers visit their parents every Friday night for dinner, where chaos and dysfunction always ensue.
FilmsPage.benidormDescription: A group of British holidaymakers descend on the Solana all-inclusive resort in Benidorm, Spain, for sun, sangria, and silliness.
FilmsPage.hatersBackOffDescription: An oddly delusional woman believes she's destined for internet fame, driving her family and neighbours crazy in the process.
FilmsPage.theJobLotDescription: The daily absurdities of staff and visitors at a West Midlands job centre.
FilmsPage.gavinStaceyDescription: A long-distance love story between an Essex boy and a Welsh girl brings two very different families hilariously together.
FilmsPage.outnumberedDescription: A middle-class London couple struggle to maintain control as their three children run rings around them with improvised chaos.
FilmsPage.freshMeatDescription: Six mismatched university students share a house in Manchester, navigating the joys and disasters of student life.
FilmsPage.theEndOfTheFingWorldDescription: A self-proclaimed psychopath and a rebellious girl go on a darkly comedic road trip across the English countryside.
FilmsPage.unbreakableKimmySchmidtDescription: A woman rescued from a doomsday cult starts a new life in New York City with relentless optimism and zero life experience.
FilmsPage.citizenKhanDescription: A self-appointed community leader in Birmingham's Pakistani community navigates family life and local politics with bombastic confidence.
FilmsPage.stepBrothersDescription: Two lazy, immature middle-aged men become stepbrothers when their parents marry, leading to an all-out war for dominance.
FilmsPage.daddysHomeDescription: A mild-mannered stepfather's life is turned upside down when his stepchildren's freewheeling biological father shows up.
FilmsPage.daddysHome2Description: Both fathers must now deal with their own dads arriving for the holidays, turning a family Christmas into competitive chaos.
FilmsPage.21JumpStreetDescription: Two rookie cops go undercover as high school students to bust a drug ring, only to find the social hierarchy has completely changed.
FilmsPage.22JumpStreetDescription: The same two undercover cops repeat the same assignment at college, with increasingly self-aware jokes about sequel conventions.
FilmsPage.murderMysteryDescription: A New York cop and his wife go on a European vacation that turns deadly when they become prime suspects in the murder of a billionaire.
FilmsPage.murderMystery2Description: The couple from the first film find themselves at the centre of another international crime when a friend is kidnapped at his own wedding.
FilmsPage.theWrongMissyDescription: A man accidentally invites the wrong woman on a corporate retreat, and she turns out to be spectacularly unhinged.
FilmsPage.thatsMyBoyDescription: A man who fathered a child with his teacher as a teenager reconnects with his now-adult, successful son before his wedding.
FilmsPage.grownUpsDescription: Five childhood friends reunite for a Fourth of July holiday weekend after learning their former basketball coach has died.
FilmsPage.grownUps2Description: The same group of friends deal with their kids' antics, new neighbours, and an 80s-themed party in their hometown.
FilmsPage.anchormanTheLegendOfRonBurgundyDescripti: A 1970s San Diego news anchor's fragile ego is shattered when an ambitious female reporter joins his team.
FilmsPage.anchorman2TheLegendContinuesDescription: Ron Burgundy and his news team are recruited to launch the first 24-hour news network in 1980s New York.
FilmsPage.getHardDescription: A wealthy finance exec convicted of fraud hires a car wash owner to prepare him for prison life, assuming he's been to jail.
FilmsPage.identityThiefDescription: A businessman tracks down the woman who stole his identity, leading to a chaotic road trip from Florida to Denver.
FilmsPage.dodgeballATrueUnderdogStoryDescription: A group of misfits enter a dodgeball tournament to save their gym from being taken over by a fitness conglomerate.
FilmsPage.norbitDescription: A mild-mannered man's chance at happiness with his childhood sweetheart is threatened by his domineering, larger-than-life wife.
FilmsPage.hereComesTheBoomDescription: A biology teacher takes up MMA fighting to raise money and save his school's extracurricular programs.
FilmsPage.chefDescription: A chef who loses his restaurant job starts a food truck with his son, rediscovering his passion for cooking across America.
FilmsPage.theInternshipDescription: Two middle-aged salesmen talk their way into Google internships, competing against brilliant young tech students.
FilmsPage.dirtyGrandpaDescription: An uptight lawyer is tricked into driving his foul-mouthed, recently widowed grandfather to Florida for spring break.
FilmsPage.paulBlartMallCopDescription: An overweight, lovable mall security guard must save the day when a group of criminals take over his shopping centre.
FilmsPage.paulBlartMallCop2Description: Paul Blart heads to Las Vegas for a security conference, where he inadvertently stumbles upon a heist at the casino hotel.
FilmsPage.bigHero6Description: A young robotics prodigy and his inflatable healthcare robot unite with a team of unlikely heroes to save their city.
FilmsPage.kungFuPandaDescription: A clumsy, food-obsessed panda is unexpectedly chosen as the Dragon Warrior and must train to defend the Valley of Peace.
FilmsPage.kungFuPanda2Description: Po must confront his past and defeat a peacock warlord who threatens to destroy kung fu with a devastating new weapon.
FilmsPage.kungFuPanda3Description: Po reunites with his biological father in a secret panda village and must train them to defeat a supernatural villain.
FilmsPage.theLegoMovieDescription: An ordinary Lego minifigure is mistakenly identified as the 'Special' and drafted into a quest to stop a tyrannical businessman.
FilmsPage.beeMovieDescription: A bee who has just graduated from college decides to sue the human race for exploiting bees after discovering humans eat honey.

Podcast.title: Lorimer's Podcast
Podcast.description: Join me for deep conversations with founders, investors, and builders in the startup ecosystem. I explore the stories behind the projects, the lessons learned, and the future of various technologies.

About.description: I'm a founder from England currently nomading around the US/UK/EU in AirBnb's. I'm interested in crypto, startups and software development. I have a background in venture capital and acting. I'm also a content creator and run a podcast called [Lorimer's Podcast](/#podcast).

News.news1Title: Devs Partner to Build Arweave’s First Lending Protocol Built with AO
News.news2Title: Revolutionizing DeFi: How Lorimer Jenkins And Marton Lederer Are Transforming Arweave With LiquidOps
News.news3Title: Unlocking the future of decentralized finance: Lorimer Jenkins’ journey in building DeFi and Web3
News.news4Title: Liquid Labs Acquires Astro to Expand Arweave DeFi

FAQ.title: Frequently Asked Questions
FAQ.a1: I'm a founder building LiquidOps, a lending and borrowing protocol on AO. I also angel invest in early-stage startups and create content about startups, crypto, and building in public.
FAQ.q2: Are you available for consulting or advisory work?
FAQ.a2: I don't do advisory work as I believe advisors are often misaligned. I prefer to angel invest in founders I want to help build with directly.
FAQ.q3: How can I pitch you for investment?
FAQ.a3: Send me an email at [heylorimerjenkins@gmail.com](mailto:heylorimerjenkins@gmail.com) with your pitch deck. I typically invest $500-$5,000 in pre-seed rounds for companies building in areas I have experience with.
FAQ.q4: What technologies do you work with?
FAQ.a4: I primarily work with TypeScript, React, Next.js, and blockchain technologies including Arweave and AO. I'm a self-taught full-stack developer.
FAQ.q5: Can I be a guest on your podcast?
FAQ.a5: I'm always looking to speak with interesting founders, investors, and builders. Reach out via email at [heylorimerjenkins@gmail.com](mailto:heylorimerjenkins@gmail.com) with a bit about yourself and what you'd like to discuss.

TimelineContent.timeline2026Description: This year LiquidOps acquired [Astro](https://www.astrousd.com/), which was founded by my good friend [Kadar Sayed Abdi](https://x.com/0xKadar).
TimelineContent.timeline2025Title: Launched LiquidOps mainnet & focused on growth
TimelineContent.timeline2025Description: This year I spent my time launching [LiquidOps' mainnet](https://x.com/Liquid_Ops/status/1905268807746060790?s=20). One of the most valuable lessons I have learnt this year is that startups are not all about product. Growth and marketing are just as (if not more) important than product, so I started [creating content](/projects#content-creator) and focusing on growth.
TimelineContent.timeline2024Description: I came up with the idea [LiquidOps](/projects#liquidops) with [Marton Lederer](https://x.com/martonlederer) this year after a rainy ambitious walk in Cambridge where I was living at the time. [AO](https://ao.arweave.net) was in it's infancy and we quickly realised the potential for a way to leverage the ecosystems current liquidity. I also worked as an Engineering Partner on [AO Ventures](https://aoventures.io). I supported teams in the cohort and helped decide who participated in demo day from a technical perspective, I ended up also participating with my new idea - [LiquidOps](/projects#liquidops).
TimelineContent.timeline2023Description: I became the first external Fellow at [Community Labs](https://communitylabs.com) right after their seed round. I returned the [Wallety](/projects#wallety) grant to focus fully on the [Arweave](https://arweave.org) ecosystem. During my time here I built [Othent](/projects#othent), Oases and [Subsidise.js](/projects#subsidisejs).
TimelineContent.timeline2022Title: Joined Community Labs & taught myself to code
TimelineContent.timeline2022Description: After realising investing didn't excite me as much as building does, I set out on a mission to learn to code from scratch. I ended up picking up learning to code quite quickly and built my first project [Wallety](/projects#wallety). It was exhausting but exhilarating. I then grabbed the attention of [Tate Berenbaum](https://x.com/TateBerenbaum) who became a close friend and I decided to join him at [Community Labs](https://communitylabs.com) as their first outside Fellow.
TimelineContent.timeline2021Title: Broke into Crypto VC from my bedroom
TimelineContent.timeline2021Description: I landed an unpaid internship at a crypto venture capital fund from the previous years cold emailing. I worked for 3 months without pay before they offered me a paid analyst role, I then worked on their venture and hedge funds for the next year. I spent my time mainly doing due dilligence on dealflow, took notes in their weekly investment communitee meetings and also met with founders who wanted to pitch the firm. During this year I also volunteered a [Polkadot Ambassador](https://polkadot.com/community/ambassador-program) where I helped build out the community and held a IRL London picnic where over 100 people turned up including ecosystem teams and founders.
TimelineContent.timeline2020Title: Crypto Teen & dropping out of drama school
TimelineContent.timeline2020Description: While I was attending drama school at [Emil Dale Academy](https://www.emildale.co.uk), I started a Crypto TikTok educational channel aimed at educating Gen Z on Crypto. In a bid to break into the industry I decided to cold email over 500 companies, investment firms and projects on if they would take me on as a unpaid worker. Out of the over 500 emails about 6 hit. I used to take Zoom meetings in the car park of school with my classmates phone that had data on while I skipped classes to pitch VCs and businesses about potentially hiring me. It was a really surreal time in my life and has just kept getting more surreal since. This was also the year I fundraised for Drama School by collecting peoples old clothes/things to resell on eBay to pay for tuition fees after getting inspiration from Gary Vee, it worked!
TimelineContent.timeline2019Description: I joined the Ethereum community in 2019 after learning about smart contracts.
TimelineContent.timeline2017Description: While all my class mates were all selling sweets for some reason, I was fixing phone screens for cash.
TimelineContent.photo2025_8: Stayed in SF for the first time
TimelineContent.photo2020_5: The IG bot started to work

AngelPage.title: Angel Investing
AngelPage.subtitle: Backing founders building the future
introAndElevator: I love meeting fellow founders who are building something they genuinely care about. When I see potential and ways I can help beyond just capital, I'm eager to get involved early.

I typically write checks between **$500 and $5,000** in pre-seed and really early seed rounds. Although I don't write the biggest checks, I try to be useful. Whether that's introductions, product feedback, technical advice, or just being someone to talk through problems with, see more in depth information on what I do below.

Disclosure, I'm currently a full-time founder and plan to be one for the foreseeable future, so I cannot allocate full-time attention to portfolio companies. I usually only invest in companies building in similar environments to what I am currently or have built in the past, so I can directly help with problem-solving. Please see more [angel investing disclosures](/disclosures).
AngelPage.helpTitle: Notable Things I Have Done That Could Help You
helpItems: I cannot advise you on legal/accounting issues, but I can point you in the direction of those who can — lawyers, accountants, and professionals (and try to make sure you don't get scammed with high fees). To date I have created 4 limited companies in the UK and 1 Delaware C corporation.
Taught myself to be a fullstack developer from the internet
Managed small lightweight teams that can execute fast
Successfully closed multiple fundraising rounds from VCs, accelerators, grant foundations, and decentralised blockchain treasuries
Worked in startups/VCs/corporates and held pretty much every role, including CEO, engineer, analyst, had COO responsibilities and been a private software contractor
As you can probably tell from my website, I am SCRAPPY. It is a superpower I have and one I hope I can help you develop/nurture.
Launched a waitlist which had thousands of signups and grew to $55m in soft commits
Built/designed/launched numerous products in startup and corporate environments
Made pitch decks, pitches, and business plans successfully and unsuccessfully
AngelPage.pressureTitle: I Take On Problems Under Pressure and Solve Them
pressureItems: Fixed 2 major black swan events in a live mainnet DeFi protocol
Spoken in front of live/online audiences and both succeeded and TOTALLY fluffed speeches
Purchased IP, sold IP, and acquired companies
Built teams and both hired and fired team members
Worked with accountants, lawyers, freelancers, and marketing firms
Cold emailed companies/people successfully (these days I prefer warm intros)
Had to be creative to solve delicate problems, usually with numerous sensitive verticals
Had to give 1-1 negative feedback and also received it many times
Been de-banked as a crypto founder
Stood up to and squashed workplace & other founder bullies
Worked in great company cultures, worked in bad ones, built good ones, and fixed my own company's culture numerous times
In a previous life I was an actor. I can help you look human in social media content and demo day pitches
Had successful VC pitches and really really bad ones
Dealt with co-founder disputes multiple times
Judged and participated in hackathons (still not won one yet, loser)
I know how to design products and how to use tools like Figma and Webflow
AngelPage.mistakesTitle: Major Mistakes I Have Made That I Don't Want You To
mistakesItems: Spent over $50k USD on a funding round's legal fees that could have been $5k
Spent $75k USD on an audit for a pre-product-market-fit product
Spent a year building product and not fully focused on growth and marketing
Triggered a tax bill that wiped out all my life savings and put me personally into a -$26k net worth and in debt overnight
Absolutely demolished my credit score and personal finances as a founder, then rebuilt it
Forgotten the value of a dollar and how far they go
Lost literally thousands of dollars to fees from careless mistakes using incorrect software
Developed and lost having a personal ego
AngelPage.ctaText: I'd love to hear about it.
AngelPage.astroDescription: Astro simplifies blockchain liquidity management as a stablecoin issuer.
AngelPage.velaventuresDescription: Web3 venture studio behind apps like [Beacon](https://getbeaconapp.com), [Vento](https://ventoswap.com/?tab=swap) and [AO Sync](https://github.com/vela-ventures/ao-sync-sdk).
AngelPage.upshotDescription: The world's first high-stakes prediction card platform, built in the Base ecosystem.

content.content: This page contains important disclosures regarding my angel investing activities. Please read this information carefully before contacting me about investment opportunities.
Personal Capital Only

I invest my own personal money. I am **not** a venture capital fund, I do **not** manage a fund, and I do **not** accept capital from limited partners (LPs) or any other external investors. All investment decisions are made solely by me using my own funds.
Not Investment Advice

Nothing on this website should be construed as investment, legal, accounting, tax, or life advice. I am **not** authorised or regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) or any other financial regulatory body. Any investment decisions you make are your own responsibility.
No Fiduciary Duty
I do not owe any fiduciary duty to founders or companies I invest in beyond what is set out in the relevant investment documentation. I am an investor, not an advisor, director, or fiduciary.
Not a Solicitation

Nothing on this website constitutes a solicitation, offer, or recommendation to invest in any company, security, or investment product. Any information about my portfolio companies is for informational purposes only.
No Guarantee of Investment
Contacting me or sending me your pitch does **not** guarantee that I will invest. I review opportunities selectively and invest in very few companies each year (maximum 1-2).
Limited Availability

I'm currently a full-time founder and plan to be one for the foreseeable future, so I cannot allocate full-time attention to portfolio companies. I usually only invest in companies building in similar environments to what I am currently or have built in the past, so I can directly help with problem-solving.
No Advisory Relationships

I do not advise companies or founders. I think advisors are misaligned (unless for really late-stage companies) — [watch Steve Jobs explain why](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-c4CNB80SRc). I only angel invest in founders and ideas I want to get involved with and think I can help build.
Early Stage Focus

I am probably not going to be helpful to later-stage founders. I am early stage myself and can best help people at the earliest stages (before Series A). But if you are a late-stage founder and think I could be helpful, I'm still interested.
Tax Considerations

Any tax reliefs mentioned (such as SEIS or EIS) are subject to individual circumstances and HMRC rules. You should seek independent tax advice. I make no representations about the tax status of any investment.
Confidentiality

If you share confidential information with me, I will treat it with reasonable care, but I cannot guarantee absolute confidentiality. I may be exposed to similar ideas from other founders. Do not share information you are not comfortable disclosing. Unless I have signed a separate written confidentiality agreement with you, I have no obligation to treat information you send me as confidential.
Conflicts of Interest

I may invest in companies that compete with each other or with companies you are building. I am under no obligation to disclose my other investments to you, and I am under no obligation to refrain from investing in competing companies.
Risk Warning

**Angel investing in early-stage companies involves a high degree of risk.** You could lose your entire investment. Past performance is not indicative of future results. The value of investments can go down as well as up. Early-stage investments are illiquid and you may not be able to sell your shares for many years, if ever.

content.title: UK Investor Status
content.content: I am a **Self-Certified Sophisticated Investor** under the Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Financial Promotion) Order 2005. I qualify on the basis of having worked in a professional capacity in the provision of finance for small and medium enterprises within the past two years (as a contractor for blockchain accelerator programs involving early-stage investment).
content.note: **For Founders:** By sharing investment materials with me, you confirm that you have conducted appropriate checks under the UK Financial Promotions regime and reasonably believe I am eligible to receive such communications. If you need me to sign a self-certification form before sharing your pitch, I'm happy to do so.

content.content: If you have any questions about these disclosures, please contact me at hellolorimerjenkins@gmail.com.
Agreement to Terms
By accessing and using lorimerjenkins.com (the "Site"), you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service ("Terms"). If you do not agree to these Terms, please do not use the Site.
Description of Service
Lorimerjenkins.com is a personal website owned and operated by Lorimer Jenkins. The Site provides information about my work, projects, angel investing activities, and other content I choose to share.
Use of the Site
Acceptable Use

You agree to use the Site only for lawful purposes and in a way that does not infringe upon the rights of others or restrict their use of the Site. Prohibited activities include, but are not limited to:

items: Attempting to gain unauthorized access to the Site or its systems
Transmitting viruses, malware, or other harmful code
Using automated systems (bots, scrapers) without permission
Violating any applicable laws or regulations
Attempting to interfere with the Site's functionality

content.content: Access to the Site
I reserve the right to modify, suspend, or discontinue the Site at any time without notice, restrict access to certain parts of the Site, and block users who violate these Terms.
Angel Investing Information

The angel investing section of this Site is provided for informational purposes only. Nothing on this Site constitutes investment advice, an offer to buy or sell securities, or financial, legal, tax, or accounting advice. I am not authorised or regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA). Please see my [angel investing disclosures](/disclosures) for full details.
Intellectual Property

Unless otherwise noted, all content on the Site, including but not limited to text, images, graphics, logos, videos, and code, is the property of Lorimer Jenkins and is protected by copyright, trademark, and other intellectual property laws.

You are granted a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable license to access and use the Site for personal, non-commercial purposes. You may not reproduce, distribute, or republish Site content without permission, modify or create derivative works, use Site content for commercial purposes, or remove copyright or proprietary notices from content.
Submissions and Communications

If you submit pitch materials, business plans, or other information to me regarding potential investment opportunities: you retain ownership of your materials, you grant me a non-exclusive license to review and analyse your materials, I am under no obligation to review your materials or invest, I may receive similar ideas from other sources, and you are responsible for protecting your own confidential information.
External Links

The Site may contain links to third-party websites or resources. These links are provided for convenience only. I am not responsible for the content, accuracy, or practices of external sites, any damages resulting from your use of external sites, or the availability of external sites.
Disclaimer of Warranties

**THE SITE IS PROVIDED ON AN "AS IS" AND "AS AVAILABLE" BASIS WITHOUT WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND**, either express or implied, including but not limited to warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, that the Site will be uninterrupted, secure, or error-free, or regarding the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of content.
Limitation of Liability

**TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, LORIMER JENKINS SHALL NOT BE LIABLE FOR ANY** indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages, loss of profits, revenue, data, or use, damages arising from your use of the Site, investment losses, or damages from reliance on any information on this Site.

This limitation applies regardless of the legal theory and even if I have been advised of the possibility of such damages. **In no event shall my total liability exceed the amount you paid to access the Site (which is zero).**
Indemnification

You agree to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Lorimer Jenkins from any claims, damages, losses, liabilities, and expenses arising from your use of the Site, your violation of these Terms, your violation of any rights of another party, any investment decisions you make, or any materials you submit.
Privacy
Your use of the Site is also governed by my [Privacy Policy](/privacy), which is incorporated into these Terms by reference.
Changes to Terms

I reserve the right to modify these Terms at any time. Changes will be effective immediately upon posting with an updated "Last Updated" date. Your continued use of the Site after changes constitutes acceptance of the modified Terms.
Governing Law

These Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of England and Wales. Any disputes shall be resolved through good faith negotiation, and if that fails, the courts of England and Wales shall have exclusive jurisdiction.
Severability
If any provision of these Terms is found to be invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall continue in full force and effect.
Contact
If you have any questions about these Terms, please contact me at hellolorimerjenkins@gmail.com.
By using the Site, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by these Terms of Service.
Introduction
Welcome to lorimerjenkins.com (the "Site"). This Privacy Policy explains how Lorimer Jenkins ("I," "me," or "my") collects, uses, and protects information when you visit this personal website.
Information I Collect
Automatically Collected Information
When you visit the Site, I automatically collect certain information through Google Analytics, including:

items: Pages you visit and time spent on each page
Date and time of your visit

content.content: Information You Provide
Currently, this Site does not collect personal information directly from users through forms or accounts, with the following exception:

**Angel Investing Enquiries:** If you contact me regarding angel investment opportunities via email, I may receive and store information you choose to provide, including your name, email address, company information, pitch materials, and any other information contained in your correspondence.
How I Use Your Information
I use the information collected through Google Analytics to understand how visitors use the Site, improve content and user experience, analyse traffic patterns, and monitor Site performance.
I use information provided via angel investing enquiries to evaluate potential investment opportunities, communicate with founders, and maintain records of investment-related correspondence.
Google Analytics

This Site uses Google Analytics, a web analytics service provided by Google LLC. Google Analytics uses cookies to help analyse how users interact with the Site. For more information about how Google uses data, please visit: [Google's Privacy Policy](https://policies.google.com/technologies/partner-sites)
Opting Out

You can opt out of Google Analytics by installing the [Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on](https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout) or adjusting your browser settings to block or delete cookies.
Cookies

Cookies are small text files stored on your device. This Site uses cookies only through Google Analytics for the purposes described above. You can control cookie preferences through your browser settings.
Data Retention

Google Analytics data is retained for 26 months from the date of collection, after which it is automatically deleted. Information provided via angel investing enquiries is retained for as long as reasonably necessary or as required by law.
Angel Investing Communications
If you send me pitch materials or other investment-related information:

items: I will treat your information with reasonable care
I may share information with professional advisors under confidentiality obligations where necessary
I do not sell or share your information with third parties for marketing purposes
You should not send information you are not comfortable disclosing

content.content: Third-Party Links
The Site may contain links to third-party websites. I am not responsible for the privacy practices of these external sites. I encourage you to review their privacy policies.
Your Rights

Depending on your location, you may have certain rights regarding your data, including the right to access information I hold about you, request deletion of your data, object to processing, and data portability. To exercise these rights, please contact me at hellolorimerjenkins@gmail.com.
For EU Visitors (GDPR)

If you are located in the European Union, you have additional rights under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). The legal basis for processing your data is legitimate interest in improving and analysing the Site, and for angel investing communications, legitimate interest in evaluating potential investment opportunities.
For California Visitors (CCPA)

If you are a California resident, you have rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA), including the right to know what personal information is collected and the right to request deletion.
Children's Privacy

This Site is not directed to children under the age of 18. I do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 18. If you believe I have inadvertently collected such information, please contact me to have it removed.
Changes to This Policy
I may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. Any changes will be posted on this page with an updated "Last Updated" date.
Security
While I strive to protect your information, no method of transmission over the internet is 100% secure. I cannot guarantee absolute security of data transmitted to or stored on the Site.
Contact
If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact me at hellolorimerjenkins@gmail.com.
By using this Site, you consent to the collection and use of information as described in this Privacy Policy.

ProjectsPage.title: Projects
ProjectsPage.subtitle: What I've been building
ProjectsPage.walletyDescription: A [Polkadot](https://polkadot.com) & [Kusama](https://kusama.network/) ecosystem analytics website, which aimed to show users useful analytics about their wallets like spending, monthly usuage, CSV exporting and money paid in network fees. I raised 2 grants from the [Kusama DAO](https://dune.com/substrate/kusama-gov), which were later returned as I wanted to join [Community Labs](https://www.communitylabs.com/).
ProjectsPage.othentDescription: The mission of [Othent](https://othent.io) was to enable normal everyday online consumers to access blockchain projects, without the use of complex cryptographic private keys and instead use any Oauth account access like Google. I founded the project as the 1st outside Fellow incubated within [Community Labs](https://www.communitylabs.com), a software development company founded by [Tate Berenbaum](https://x.com/TateBerenbaum) in the [Arweave](https://arweave.org) ecosystem. [Othent](https://othent.io) was then aquired by [Wander](https://wander.app) into their core product, an [Arweave](https://arweave.org) & [AO](https://ao.arweave.net) ecosystem Web3 wallet that has over 50,000 users, becoming [Wander Connect](https://www.wander.app/connect).
ProjectsPage.liquidOpsDescription: A lending and borrowing protocol built on [AO](https://ao.arweave.net), aiming to unlock over $400m worth of [Arweave](https://arweave.org) tokens value. I co-founded the project with [Marton Lederer](https://x.com/martonlederer), became the 1st Fellow led company to spin out of [Community Labs](https://www.communitylabs.com), attracted thousands of [waitlist](https://x.com/Liquid_Ops/status/1863863983498805473?s=20) signups which grew to $55m soft-commits for the idea with on-chain fund verification, [pitched](https://x.com/aoTheVentures/status/1813676139795374171?s=20) at [AO Ventures](https://www.aoventures.io) demo day and then raised a [$325k pre-seed round](https://www.ibtimes.co.uk/revolutionizing-defi-how-lorimer-jenkins-marton-lederer-are-transforming-arweave-liquidops-1729945). We launched mainnet, have numerious intergrations including the AO Chrome/IOS/Andriod wallets [Wander](https://wander.app) ([demo here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4ODxijaC0Dc)) & [Beacon](https://getbeaconapp.com) ([demo here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GeQ01-rBUPQ&t=11s)). We also completed & passed audits by the firms [Spearbit](https://cantina.xyz/solutions/spearbit) & [Quantstamp](https://quantstamp.com/).
ProjectsPage.contentCreationDescription: I create video content across all major social media platforms. I aim for this to be a great way to build my online community, show the world what I am working on and meet new people in new places. I also started a podcast called [Lorimer's Podcast](/#podcast).
ProjectsPage.cryptoTeenDescription: [Crypto Teen](https://www.tiktok.com/@lorimer__jenkins) is a cryptocurrency TikTok channel aiming to educate Gen Z on what crypto is, covering basic concepts and know-how in the Web3 blockchain space.
ProjectsPage.subsidisejsDescription: Subsidise JS is a package built to enable [Arweave 4096-bit RSA-PSS JWK's](https://medium.com/@perma_dao/wallet-and-did-in-the-arweave-ecosystem-5714877fe745) to bundle transactions together and pay gas fees for other users transactions via the [ANS-102](https://github.com/ArweaveTeam/arweave-standards/blob/master/ans/ANS-102.md) Arweave network standard. I planned to intergrate this into other projects who wanted to cover their users gas upload fees, which would enable users to not have to pay AR tokens to use a Web 2 consuer app built on Arweave.
ProjectsPage.astroDescription: Astro is the liquidity solution built for seamless integration within Web3 ecosystems. By aggregating multiple stablecoins and fiat currencies into a single, unified asset - USDA, Astro ensures frictionless value exchange between real-world and on-chain applications.
ProjectsPage.coolarweaveaddressDescription: This repo allows you to generate lots of [Arweave 4096-bit RSA-PSS JWK's](https://medium.com/@perma_dao/wallet-and-did-in-the-arweave-ecosystem-5714877fe745) to find cool and unique wallet addresses. Claude will automatically detect the cool addresses based on your desired parameters.
ProjectsPage.aothecomputerDescription: A friend told me a story of being able to aquire a really saught after domain for next to nothing, I was amazed (plus a tad jelous) and couldn't stop thinking about the killer deal he got. So I started searching Namecheap to see if there were any other killer deals up for grabs. Turns out [AO The Computer .com](https://aothecomputer.com) was available to purchase for $11.48 a year, take that [redacted] 😜.
ProjectsPage.aohtmlDescription: AO HTML is a tool that enables you to create a webpage via a HTML file that auto updates based on content delivered from the AO network via a process. Imagine a decentralised website with content delivery via a decentralised provider like a DAO, for example the website would auto update after a DAO proposal was approved and all Web2 front ends on Vercel/Netlify would too using this script.

BookshelfPage.title: Bookshelf
BookshelfPage.subtitle: Books that have helped shape my thinking
BookshelfPage.richDadPoorDadNotes: A great introduction to financial literacy and the importance of assets over liabilities.
BookshelfPage.1984Notes: A chilling and prophetic dystopian novel that remains terrifyingly relevant today.
BookshelfPage.zeroToOneAuthorBio: Co-founder of PayPal and Palantir Technologies
BookshelfPage.zeroToOneNotes: It provides a guide for entrepreneurs on how to build monopolies and create value by questioning conventional wisdom to find new opportunities, challenge competition, and build valuable companies.
BookshelfPage.hardThingNotes: Brutally honest advice on building and running a startup. No sugarcoating, just real experiences.
BookshelfPage.whatYouDoNotes: Fascinating exploration of company culture through historical examples from Toussaint Louverture to Genghis Khan.
BookshelfPage.spareNotes: A candid look into royal life and the pressures of growing up in the public eye as a royal.
BookshelfPage.riseAndFallNotes: A biography that chronicles the lives of Prince Andrew and Sarah Ferguson, from their marriage to the present day.
